H0.text: Applying the same amount of light to all the plants is the action the scientist should take regarding light during her experiment testing whether Hypergrow helps plants grow faster than Supergrow, a fertilizer already on the market.

H1.text: Apply only green light to all the plants is what the scientist should do with light during the experiment to test whether Hypergrow helps plants grow faster than Supergrow.

H2.text: Flash the lights to simulate a partly cloudy day is what the plant scientist should do with light during the experiment testing whether Hypergrow helps plants grow faster than Supergrow.

H3.text: Keep the plants in darkness is what the scientist should do with light during the experiment to determine whether Hypergrow helps plants grow faster than the market fertilizer Supergrow.

A4.text: Chlorophyll is the primary pigment in plants; it is a porphyrin that absorbs red and blue wavelengths of light while reflecting green.
